intro: Roscoea purpurea var. procera, commonly known as the purple rhododendron or Himalayan orchid, is a striking member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia, particularly Nepal, Bhutan, and Sichuan in China. The plant features tall, slender stems with large, showy purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple hues. Roscoea purpurea var. procera is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in cool, moist environments.
